line_text: Had she a tongue to speak, now would she say
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: That to her brother which I said to thee:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: His napkin, with his true tears all bewet,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Can do no service on her sorrowful cheeks.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: O, what a sympathy of woe is this,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: As far from help as Limbo is from bliss!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Titus Andronicus, my lord the emperor
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Sends thee this word,--that, if thou love thy sons,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Let Marcus, Lucius, or thyself, old Titus,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Or any one of you, chop off your hand,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: And send it to the king: he for the same
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Will send thee hither both thy sons alive;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: And that shall be the ransom for their fault.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: O gracious emperor! O gentle Aaron!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Did ever raven sing so like a lark,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: That gives sweet tidings of the sun's uprise?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: With all my heart, I'll send the emperor My hand:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Good Aaron, wilt thou help to chop it off?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Stay, father! for that noble hand of thine,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: That hath thrown down so many enemies,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Shall not be sent: my hand will serve the turn:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: My youth can better spare my blood than you;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: And therefore mine shall save my brothers' lives.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Which of your hands hath not defended Rome,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: And rear'd aloft the bloody battle-axe,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Writing destruction on the enemy's castle?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: O, none of both but are of high desert:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: My hand hath been but idle; let it serve
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: To ransom my two nephews from their death;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Then have I kept it to a worthy end.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Nay, come, agree whose hand shall go along,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: For fear they die before their pardon come.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: My hand shall go.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: By heaven, it shall not go!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Sirs, strive no more: such wither'd herbs as these
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Are meet for plucking up, and therefore mine.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Sweet father, if I shall be thought thy son,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Let me redeem my brothers both from death.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: And, for our father's sake and mother's care,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Now let me show a brother's love to thee.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Agree between you; I will spare my hand.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Then I'll go fetch an axe.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: But I will use the axe.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Come hither, Aaron; I'll deceive them both:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Lend me thy hand, and I will give thee mine.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: And never, whilst I live, deceive men so:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: But I'll deceive you in another sort,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: And that you'll say, ere half an hour pass.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Now stay your strife: what shall be is dispatch'd.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Good Aaron, give his majesty my hand:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Tell him it was a hand that warded him
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: From thousand dangers; bid him bury it
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: More hath it merited; that let it have.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: As for my sons, say I account of them
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: As jewels purchased at an easy price;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: And yet dear too, because I bought mine own.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: I go, Andronicus: and for thy hand
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Look by and by to have thy sons with thee.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Their heads, I mean. O, how this villany
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Doth fat me with the very thoughts of it!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Let fools do good, and fair men call for grace.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Aaron will have his soul black like his face.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: O, here I lift this one hand up to heaven,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: And bow this feeble ruin to the earth:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: If any power pities wretched tears,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: To that I call!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: What, wilt thou kneel with me?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Do, then, dear heart; for heaven shall hear our prayers;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Or with our sighs we'll breathe the welkin dim,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: And stain the sun with fog, as sometime clouds
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: When they do hug him in their melting bosoms.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: O brother, speak with possibilities,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: And do not break into these deep extremes.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Is not my sorrow deep, having no bottom?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Then be my passions bottomless with them.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: But yet let reason govern thy lament.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: If there were reason for these miseries,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Then into limits could I bind my woes:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: When heaven doth weep, doth not the earth o'erflow?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: If the winds rage, doth not the sea wax mad,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Threatening the welkin with his big-swoln face?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: And wilt thou have a reason for this coil?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: I am the sea; hark, how her sighs do blow!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: She is the weeping welkin, I the earth:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Then must my sea be moved with her sighs;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Then must my earth with her continual tears
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Become a deluge, overflow'd and drown'd;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: For why my bowels cannot hide her woes,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: But like a drunkard must I vomit them.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Then give me leave, for losers will have leave
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: To ease their stomachs with their bitter tongues.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Worthy Andronicus, ill art thou repaid
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: For that good hand thou sent'st the emperor.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Here are the heads of thy two noble sons;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: And here's thy hand, in scorn to thee sent back;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Thy griefs their sports, thy resolution mock'd;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: That woe is me to think upon thy woes
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: More than remembrance of my father's death.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Now let hot AEtna cool in Sicily,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: And be my heart an ever-burning hell!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: These miseries are more than may be borne.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: To weep with them that weep doth ease some deal;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: But sorrow flouted at is double death.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Ah, that this sight should make so deep a wound,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: And yet detested life not shrink thereat!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: That ever death should let life bear his name,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Where life hath no more interest but to breathe!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Alas, poor heart, that kiss is comfortless
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: As frozen water to a starved snake.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: When will this fearful slumber have an end?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Now, farewell, flattery: die, Andronicus;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Thou dost not slumber: see, thy two sons' heads,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Thy warlike hand, thy mangled daughter here:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Thy other banish'd son, with this dear sight
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Struck pale and bloodless; and thy brother, I,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Even like a stony image, cold and numb.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Ah, now no more will I control thy griefs:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Rend off thy silver hair, thy other hand
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Gnawing with thy teeth; and be this dismal sight
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: The closing up of our most wretched eyes;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Now is a time to storm; why art thou still?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Ha, ha, ha!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Why dost thou laugh? it fits not with this hour.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Why, I have not another tear to shed:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Besides, this sorrow is an enemy,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: And would usurp upon my watery eyes
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: And make them blind with tributary tears:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Then which way shall I find Revenge's cave?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: For these two heads do seem to speak to me,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: And threat me I shall never come to bliss
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Till all these mischiefs be return'd again
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Even in their throats that have committed them.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Come, let me see what task I have to do.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: You heavy people, circle me about,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: That I may turn me to each one of you,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: And swear unto my soul to right your wrongs.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: The vow is made. Come, brother, take a head;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: And in this hand the other I will bear.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Lavinia, thou shalt be employ'd: these arms!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Bear thou my hand, sweet wench, between thy teeth.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: As for thee, boy, go get thee from my sight;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Thou art an exile, and thou must not stay:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Hie to the Goths, and raise an army there:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: And, if you love me, as I think you do,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Let's kiss and part, for we have much to do.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Farewell Andronicus, my noble father,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: The wofull'st man that ever lived in Rome:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Farewell, proud Rome; till Lucius come again,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: He leaves his pledges dearer than his life:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Farewell, Lavinia, my noble sister;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: O, would thou wert as thou tofore hast been!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: But now nor Lucius nor Lavinia lives
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: But in oblivion and hateful griefs.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: If Lucius live, he will requite your wrongs;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: And make proud Saturnine and his empress
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Beg at the gates, like Tarquin and his queen.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: Now will I to the Goths, and raise a power,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: To be revenged on Rome and Saturnine.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.

line_text: So, so; now sit: and look you eat no more
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Than will preserve just so much strength in us
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: As will revenge these bitter woes of ours.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Marcus, unknit that sorrow-wreathen knot:
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Thy niece and I, poor creatures, want our hands,
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: And cannot passionate our tenfold grief
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: With folded arms. This poor right hand of mine
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Is left to tyrannize upon my breast;
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Who, when my heart, all mad with misery,
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Beats in this hollow prison of my flesh,
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Then thus I thump it down.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Thou map of woe, that thus dost talk in signs!
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: When thy poor heart beats with outrageous beating,
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Thou canst not strike it thus to make it still.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Wound it with sighing, girl, kill it with groans;
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Or get some little knife between thy teeth,
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: And just against thy heart make thou a hole;
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: That all the tears that thy poor eyes let fall
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: May run into that sink, and soaking in
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Drown the lamenting fool in sea-salt tears.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Fie, brother, fie! teach her not thus to lay
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Such violent hands upon her tender life.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: How now! has sorrow made thee dote already?
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Why, Marcus, no man should be mad but I.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: What violent hands can she lay on her life?
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Ah, wherefore dost thou urge the name of hands;
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: To bid AEneas tell the tale twice o'er,
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: How Troy was burnt and he made miserable?
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: O, handle not the theme, to talk of hands,
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Lest we remember still that we have none.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Fie, fie, how franticly I square my talk,
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: As if we should forget we had no hands,
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: If Marcus did not name the word of hands!
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Come, let's fall to; and, gentle girl, eat this:
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Here is no drink! Hark, Marcus, what she says;
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: I can interpret all her martyr'd signs;
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: She says she drinks no other drink but tears,
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Brew'd with her sorrow, mesh'd upon her cheeks:
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Speechless complainer, I will learn thy thought;
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: In thy dumb action will I be as perfect
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: As begging hermits in their holy prayers:
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Thou shalt not sigh, nor hold thy stumps to heaven,
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Nor wink, nor nod, nor kneel, nor make a sign,
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: But I of these will wrest an alphabet
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: And by still practise learn to know thy meaning.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Good grandsire, leave these bitter deep laments:
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Make my aunt merry with some pleasing tale.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Alas, the tender boy, in passion moved,
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Doth weep to see his grandsire's heaviness.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Peace, tender sapling; thou art made of tears,
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: And tears will quickly melt thy life away.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: What dost thou strike at, Marcus, with thy knife?
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: At that that I have kill'd, my lord; a fly.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Out on thee, murderer! thou kill'st my heart;
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Mine eyes are cloy'd with view of tyranny:
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: A deed of death done on the innocent
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Becomes not Titus' brother: get thee gone:
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: I see thou art not for my company.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Alas, my lord, I have but kill'd a fly.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: But how, if that fly had a father and mother?
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: How would he hang his slender gilded wings,
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: And buzz lamenting doings in the air!
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Poor harmless fly,
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: That, with his pretty buzzing melody,
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Came here to make us merry! and thou hast
scene_title: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.

scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: She swooned almost at my pleasing tale,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: And for my tidings gave me twenty kisses.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: What, canst thou say all this, and never blush?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: Ay, like a black dog, as the saying is.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: Art thou not sorry for these heinous deeds?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: Ay, that I had not done a thousand more.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: Even now I curse the day--and yet, I think,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: Few come within the compass of my curse,--
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: Wherein I did not some notorious ill,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: As kill a man, or else devise his death,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: Ravish a maid, or plot the way to do it,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: Accuse some innocent and forswear myself,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: Set deadly enmity between two friends,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: Make poor men's cattle break their necks;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: Set fire on barns and hay-stacks in the night,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: And bid the owners quench them with their tears.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: Oft have I digg'd up dead men from their graves,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: And set them upright at their dear friends' doors,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: Even when their sorrows almost were forgot;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: And on their skins, as on the bark of trees,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: Have with my knife carved in Roman letters,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: 'Let not your sorrow die, though I am dead.'
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: Tut, I have done a thousand dreadful things
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: As willingly as one would kill a fly,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: And nothing grieves me heartily indeed
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: But that I cannot do ten thousand more.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: Bring down the devil; for he must not die
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: So sweet a death as hanging presently.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: If there be devils, would I were a devil,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: To live and burn in everlasting fire,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: So I might have your company in hell,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: But to torment you with my bitter tongue!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: Sirs, stop his mouth, and let him speak no more.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: My lord, there is a messenger from Rome
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: Desires to be admitted to your presence.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: Let him come near.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: Welcome, AEmilius what's the news from Rome?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: Lord Lucius, and you princes of the Goths,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: The Roman emperor greets you all by me;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: And, for he understands you are in arms,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: He craves a parley at your father's house,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: Willing you to demand your hostages,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: And they shall be immediately deliver'd.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: What says our general?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: AEmilius, let the emperor give his pledges
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: Unto my father and my uncle Marcus,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: And we will come. March away.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.

line_text: Thus, in this strange and sad habiliment,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: I will encounter with Andronicus,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And say I am Revenge, sent from below
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: To join with him and right his heinous wrongs.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Knock at his study, where, they say, he keeps,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: To ruminate strange plots of dire revenge;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Tell him Revenge is come to join with him,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And work confusion on his enemies.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Who doth molest my contemplation?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Is it your trick to make me ope the door,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: That so my sad decrees may fly away,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And all my study be to no effect?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: You are deceived: for what I mean to do
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: See here in bloody lines I have set down;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And what is written shall be executed.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Titus, I am come to talk with thee.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: No, not a word; how can I grace my talk,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Wanting a hand to give it action?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Thou hast the odds of me; therefore no more.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: If thou didst know me, thou wouldest talk with me.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: I am not mad; I know thee well enough:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Witness this wretched stump, witness these crimson lines;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Witness these trenches made by grief and care,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Witness the tiring day and heavy night;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Witness all sorrow, that I know thee well
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: For our proud empress, mighty Tamora:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Is not thy coming for my other hand?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Know, thou sad man, I am not Tamora;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: She is thy enemy, and I thy friend:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: I am Revenge: sent from the infernal kingdom,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: To ease the gnawing vulture of thy mind,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: By working wreakful vengeance on thy foes.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Come down, and welcome me to this world's light;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Confer with me of murder and of death:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: There's not a hollow cave or lurking-place,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: No vast obscurity or misty vale,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Where bloody murder or detested rape
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Can couch for fear, but I will find them out;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And in their ears tell them my dreadful name,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Revenge, which makes the foul offender quake.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Art thou Revenge? and art thou sent to me,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: To be a torment to mine enemies?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: I am; therefore come down, and welcome me.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Do me some service, ere I come to thee.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Lo, by thy side where Rape and Murder stands;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Now give me some surance that thou art Revenge,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Stab them, or tear them on thy chariot-wheels;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And then I'll come and be thy waggoner,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And whirl along with thee about the globe.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Provide thee two proper palfreys, black as jet,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: To hale thy vengeful waggon swift away,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And find out murderers in their guilty caves:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And when thy car is loaden with their heads,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: I will dismount, and by the waggon-wheel
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Trot, like a servile footman, all day long,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Even from Hyperion's rising in the east
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Until his very downfall in the sea:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And day by day I'll do this heavy task,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: So thou destroy Rapine and Murder there.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: These are my ministers, and come with me.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Are these thy ministers? what are they call'd?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Rapine and Murder; therefore called so,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Cause they take vengeance of such kind of men.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Good Lord, how like the empress' sons they are!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And you, the empress! but we worldly men
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Have miserable, mad, mistaking eyes.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: O sweet Revenge, now do I come to thee;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And, if one arm's embracement will content thee,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: I will embrace thee in it by and by.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: This closing with him fits his lunacy
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Whate'er I forge to feed his brain-sick fits,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Do you uphold and maintain in your speeches,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: For now he firmly takes me for Revenge;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And, being credulous in this mad thought,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: I'll make him send for Lucius his son;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And, whilst I at a banquet hold him sure,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: I'll find some cunning practise out of hand,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: To scatter and disperse the giddy Goths,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Or, at the least, make them his enemies.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: See, here he comes, and I must ply my theme.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Long have I been forlorn, and all for thee:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Welcome, dread Fury, to my woful house:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Rapine and Murder, you are welcome too.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: How like the empress and her sons you are!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Well are you fitted, had you but a Moor:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Could not all hell afford you such a devil?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: For well I wot the empress never wags
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: But in her company there is a Moor;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And, would you represent our queen aright,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: It were convenient you had such a devil:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: But welcome, as you are. What shall we do?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: What wouldst thou have us do, Andronicus?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Show me a murderer, I'll deal with him.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Show me a villain that hath done a rape,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And I am sent to be revenged on him.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Show me a thousand that have done thee wrong,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And I will be revenged on them all.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Look round about the wicked streets of Rome;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And when thou find'st a man that's like thyself.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Good Murder, stab him; he's a murderer.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Go thou with him; and when it is thy hap
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: To find another that is like to thee,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Good Rapine, stab him; he's a ravisher.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Go thou with them; and in the emperor's court
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: There is a queen, attended by a Moor;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Well mayst thou know her by thy own proportion,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: for up and down she doth resemble thee:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: I pray thee, do on them some violent death;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: They have been violent to me and mine.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Well hast thou lesson'd us; this shall we do.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: But would it please thee, good Andronicus,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: To send for Lucius, thy thrice-valiant son,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Who leads towards Rome a band of warlike Goths,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And bid him come and banquet at thy house;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: When he is here, even at thy solemn feast,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: I will bring in the empress and her sons,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: The emperor himself and all thy foes;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And at thy mercy shalt they stoop and kneel,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And on them shalt thou ease thy angry heart.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: What says Andronicus to this device?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Marcus, my brother! 'tis sad Titus calls.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Go, gentle Marcus, to thy nephew Lucius;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Thou shalt inquire him out among the Goths:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Bid him repair to me, and bring with him
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Some of the chiefest princes of the Goths;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Bid him encamp his soldiers where they are:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Tell him the emperor and the empress too
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Feast at my house, and he shall feast with them.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: This do thou for my love; and so let him,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: As he regards his aged father's life.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: This will I do, and soon return again.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Now will I hence about thy business,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And take my ministers along with me.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Nay, nay, let Rape and Murder stay with me;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Or else I'll call my brother back again,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And cleave to no revenge but Lucius.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: bide with him,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Whiles I go tell my lord the emperor
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: How I have govern'd our determined jest?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Yield to his humour, smooth and speak him fair,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And tarry with him till I turn again.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And will o'erreach them in their own devices:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: A pair of cursed hell-hounds and their dam!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Madam, depart at pleasure; leave us here.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Farewell, Andronicus: Revenge now goes
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: To lay a complot to betray thy foes.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: I know thou dost; and, sweet Revenge, farewell.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Tell us, old man, how shall we be employ'd?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Tut, I have work enough for you to do.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Publius, come hither, Caius, and Valentine!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: What is your will?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Know you these two?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: The empress' sons, I take them, Chiron and Demetrius.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Fie, Publius, fie! thou art too much deceived;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: The one is Murder, Rape is the other's name;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And therefore bind them, gentle Publius.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Caius and Valentine, lay hands on them.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Oft have you heard me wish for such an hour,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And now I find it; therefore bind them sure,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And stop their mouths, if they begin to cry.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Villains, forbear! we are the empress' sons.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: And therefore do we what we are commanded.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Stop close their mouths, let them not speak a word.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Is he sure bound? look that you bind them fast.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Come, come, Lavinia; look, thy foes are bound.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Sirs, stop their mouths, let them not speak to me;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: But let them hear what fearful words I utter.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: O villains, Chiron and Demetrius!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Here stands the spring whom you have stain'd with mud,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: This goodly summer with your winter mix'd.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: You kill'd her husband, and for that vile fault
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Two of her brothers were condemn'd to death,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: My hand cut off and made a merry jest;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Both her sweet hands, her tongue, and that more dear
scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

line_text: Than hands or tongue, her spotless chastity,

scene_title: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: My lord the emperor, resolve me this:

scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: A pattern, precedent, and lively warrant,

line_text: For me, most wretched, to perform the like.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Die, die, Lavinia, and thy shame with thee;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: What hast thou done, unnatural and unkind?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Kill'd her, for whom my tears have made me blind.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: I am as woful as Virginius was,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: And have a thousand times more cause than he
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: To do this outrage: and it now is done.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Then, noble auditory, be it known to you,

scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Of this was Tamora delivered;

line_text: The issue of an irreligious Moor,

line_text: Chief architect and plotter of these woes:

scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: These wrongs, unspeakable, past patience,

scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: And, from the place where you behold us now,

scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Will, hand in hand, all headlong cast us down.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: And on the ragged stones beat forth our brains,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: And make a mutual closure of our house.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Meet and agreeing with thine infancy;

line_text: Shed yet some small drops from thy tender spring,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Because kind nature doth require it so:
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Friends should associate friends in grief and woe:
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Bid him farewell; commit him to the grave;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Do him that kindness, and take leave of him.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: O grandsire, grandsire! even with all my heart
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Would I were dead, so you did live again!
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: O Lord, I cannot speak to him for weeping;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: My tears will choke me, if I ope my mouth.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: You sad Andronici, have done with woes:
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Give sentence on this execrable wretch,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: That hath been breeder of these dire events.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Set him breast-deep in earth, and famish him;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: There let him stand, and rave, and cry for food;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: If any one relieves or pities him,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: For the offence he dies. This is our doom:
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Some stay to see him fasten'd in the earth.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: O, why should wrath be mute, and fury dumb?
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: I am no baby, I, that with base prayers
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: I should repent the evils I have done:
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Ten thousand worse than ever yet I did
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Would I perform, if I might have my will;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: If one good deed in all my life I did,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: I do repent it from my very soul.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Some loving friends convey the emperor hence,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: And give him burial in his father's grave:
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: My father and Lavinia shall forthwith
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Be closed in our household's monument.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: As for that heinous tiger, Tamora,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: No funeral rite, nor man m mourning weeds,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: No mournful bell shall ring her burial;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: But throw her forth to beasts and birds of prey:
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Her life was beast-like, and devoid of pity;
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: And, being so, shall have like want of pity.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: See justice done on Aaron, that damn'd Moor,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: By whom our heavy haps had their beginning:
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: Then, afterwards, to order well the state,
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.

line_text: That like events may ne'er it ruinate.
scene_title: SCENE III.  Court of TITUS's house. A banquet set out.
